title: Installation issue: dd4hep fails at cmake stage
body:
<!-- Thanks for taking the time to report this build failure. To proceed with the report please:

1. Title the issue "Installation issue: <name-of-the-package>".
2. Provide the information required below.

We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively! -->

### Steps to reproduce the issue
Trying to install `dd4hep` on my Ubuntu 20.04 machine fails with a rather weird error message from cmake

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->
```console
$ spack install dd4hep+assimp+geant4+lcio+xercesc+hepmc3 ^podio@master
```

which leads to the following error
```console
1 error found in build log:
     219    --    /home/tmadlener/tmp/spack_docker_install/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu20.04-skylake/gcc-9.3.0/zstd-1.5.0-tlupiwbfa7kzhv6lznimpr5t52jaah4w;
     220    -- CMAKE_MODULE_PATH =
     221    --    /tmp/tmadlener/spack-stage/spack-stage-dd4hep-1.16.1-o3ccmwskwx367bllz74ljhxjrl3ddks5/spack-src/cmake;
     222    -- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
     223    --
     224    -- Configuring done
  >> 225    CMake Error in DDCAD/CMakeLists.txt:
     226      No known features for C compiler
     227    
     228      ""
     229    
     230      version .
     231    
```

It looks like cmake "forgets" about the compiler while it is configuring. However, to me this looks weird because the error seems to happen **after** cmake has successfully configured dd4hep. I have tried this with the default `cmake@3.16.3` that comes with Ubuntu 20.04, and also with `cmake@3.18.4` but the error remains unchanged. I don't think it is a problem in dd4heps cmake setup, because I can build it outside of spack. Just to make sure that it is not my spack setup that is causing any problems here, I have run everything in a fresh spack installation with default settings, but the problem remains.

Pinging the maintainers: @vvolkl, @drbenmorgan 

### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->
```
* **Spack:** 0.16.2-3076-849943c63d
* **Python:** 3.8.5
* **Platform:** linux-ubuntu20.04-skylake
* **Concretizer:** original
```
<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->

The `packages.yaml` as populated via `spack external find`. The only change that I added is the following, which is needed to get around a concretization conflict that appears with the original concretizer.
```
packages:
  all:
    variants: cxxstd=17
```

[packages.yaml.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/6630885/packages.yaml.txt)

### Additional information
